body: Are there any other errors logged in the build output?

Can you let me know what logs I should fetch ? 

[EDIT]

I did a re-try after running clean.py and the build script failed.

`938/1148] ACTION js2asar: js2asar_629415ef79075789a9917f9e4cf299ce

  File "tools/js2asar.py", line 20, in main
    call_asar(archive, os.path.join(output_dir, folder_name))
  File "tools/js2asar.py", line 35, in call_asar
    subprocess.check_call([asar, 'pack', output_dir, archive])
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 535, in check_call

  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 522, in call
    return Popen(*popenargs, **kwargs).wait()

[938/1148] CXX obj/atom/app/electron_lib.atom_main_delegate.o
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.`

> I did a re-try after running clean.py and the build script failed.
> 
> [Errno 2] No such file or directory

Looks like a file might be missing, does `npm run bootstrap` properly complete for you?

> clang: error: unable to execute command: Killed
> clang: error: linker command failed due to signal (use -v to see invocation)
> ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.

The linker is killed, which usually means you don't have enough RAM on your machine. Please check http://electron.atom.io/docs/development/build-instructions-linux/#prerequisites for the requirements for building Release version of Electron.

Thank you. It was indeed a RAM issue. 

Now I am running into a different problem trying to compile using gcc and g++

I followed the build-instructions and executed 

`$ env CC=gcc CXX=g++ ./script/bootstrap.py -v --build_libchromiumcontent --disable_clang
`
yet I am getting errors that g++ is not able to find header files such as cstring and memory 

```
[3/14470] CXX obj/v8/src/base/v8_libbase.accounting-allocator.o
FAILED: g++ -MMD -MF obj/v8/src/base/v8_libbase.accounting-allocator.o.d -DU_COMBINED_IMPLEMENTATION -DUNISTR_FROM_CHAR_EXPLICIT= -DUNISTR_FROM_STRING_EXPLICIT= -DU_NO_DEFAULT_INCLUDE_UTF_HEADERS=0 -DV8_DEPRECATION_WARNINGS -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -DDISABLE_NACL -DCHROMIUM_BUILD -DCR_CLANG_REVISION=269902-1 -DUI_COMPOSITOR_IMAGE_TRANSPORT -DUSE_AURA=1 -DUSE_PANGO=1 -DUSE_CAIRO=1 -DUSE_DEFAULT_RENDER_THEME=1 -DUSE_LIBJPEG_TURBO=1 -DUSE_X11=1 -DUSE_CLIPBOARD_AURAX11=1 -DENABLE_WEBRTC=1 -DENABLE_MEDIA_ROUTER=1 -DUSE_PROPRIETARY_CODECS -DENABLE_PEPPER_CDMS -DENABLE_NOTIFICATIONS -DENABLE_TOPCHROME_MD=1 -DUSE_UDEV -DFIELDTRIAL_TESTING_ENABLED -DENABLE_TASK_MANAGER=1 -DENABLE_EXTENSIONS=1 -DENABLE_PDF=1 -DENABLE_PLUGINS=1 -DENABLE_SESSION_SERVICE=1 -DENABLE_THEMES=1 -DENABLE_PRINTING=1 -DENABLE_BASIC_PRINTING=1 -DENABLE_PRINT_PREVIEW=1 -DENABLE_SPELLCHECK=1 -DENABLE_CAPTIVE_PORTAL_DETECTION=1 -DENABLE_SUPERVISED_USERS=1 -DENABLE_MDNS=1 -DENABLE_SERVICE_DISCOVERY=1 -DV8_USE_EXTERNAL_STARTUP_DATA -DFULL_SAFE_BROWSING -DSAFE_BROWSING_CSD -DSAFE_BROWSING_DB_LOCAL -DV8_TARGET_ARCH_X64 -DV8_I18N_SUPPORT -DV8_SHARED -DBUILDING_V8_SHARED -DUSE_LIBPCI=1 -DUSE_GLIB=1 -DUSE_NSS_CERTS=1 -DNDEBUG -DNVALGRIND -DDYNAMIC_ANNOTATIONS_ENABLED=0 -I../../v8 -Igen -fstack-protector --param=ssp-buffer-size=4 -pthread -fno-strict-aliasing -Wno-extra -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-missing-field-initializers -pipe -fPIC -g -B/home/ahzaki/electron/vendor/brightray/vendor/libchromiumcontent/src/third_party/binutils/Linux_x64/Release/bin -Wno-unused-local-typedefs -B/home/ahzaki/electron/vendor/brightray/vendor/libchromiumcontent/src/third_party/binutils/Linux_x64/Release/bin -m64 -march=x86-64 --sysroot=/home/ahzaki/electron/vendor/brightray/vendor/libchromiumcontent/src/build/linux/debian_wheezy_amd64-sysroot -m64 -fno-ident -funwind-tables  -O3 -fno-exceptions -fno-rtti -fno-threadsafe-statics -Wno-deprecated -std=gnu++11 -Wno-narrowing  -c ../../v8/src/base/accounting-allocator.cc -o obj/v8/src/base/v8_libbase.accounting-allocator.o
In file included from ../../v8/src/base/macros.h:10:0,
                 from ../../v8/src/base/accounting-allocator.h:9,
                 from ../../v8/src/base/accounting-allocator.cc:5:
../../v8/src/base/logging.h:8:19: fatal error: cstring: No such file or directory
 #include <cstring>
                   ^
compilation terminated.
```

Your compiler is not configured correctly to find the standard library headers, you might want to try whether it can compile other projects.
